We have a very exciting announcement! Beginning Monday, September 14, 2020, ALL B-C-S students (including ROLO) will be able to receive a FREE breakfast and lunch daily through December 18, 2020, or when grant funds are depleted, whichever is sooner. These free meals are due to a grant from the Ohio Department of Education and the USDA.

HOW IT WORKS
Very simply, students attending the buildings will simply get in line for breakfast and lunch as usual.

Students in ROLO will need to call by Noon each Monday for meal pick up at RC Waters. Pickups will remain once a week on Wednesdays and will include 5 breakfast and 5 lunches. You can pick up from either 9-10AM or 5PM-6PM. Please call the food service office to register at 419-898-4449 or email VCoffman@bcssd.com if you have not already done so.

Extra milk, snacks, and entrees will still be sold at regular price.

To view our menu, please see the school website.

Account balances will remain on student accounts.

Please free to call or email Vicki Coffman at 419-898-4449 or VCoffman@bcssd.com

Oak Harbor Bands
August 16 at 8:58 PM ¬∑

This past week we had our HS Marching Band Camp. While it was far from a normal week, we were all glad to get back at it. This season will definitely put us in uncharted territory, but we are working hard to make the best of whatever situation presents itself.

We would like to give a BIG shout out to our students! From our student leadership to our new members, everyone worked very hard and was mindful of all of the restrictions we are working under. Band camp was entirely outside, and while hot, the students had a great attitude all week.

We also want to thank all of the adults who helped us. Thank you to all who helped with uniform fittings (especially our uniform chairs Mrs. Dedes & Mrs. Brough) and our band camp staff who helped us with music and marching preparation. We'd also like to thank our superintendent Dr. Parmigian for providing the band members with ice cream bars this past Friday! üòÄ

It takes a village to run a band program, and we are extremely grateful for our village of students, parents, and school personnel.

Sincerely,

Mr. Magoto & Mr. Head

SESLAR TO SERVE AS ROTARY PRESIDENT

Benton-Carroll-Salem School District Director of Technology Mr. Devin Seslar was recently installed as the President of Oak Harbor Rotary Club at a banquet held at the Catawba Island Club. The objectives of Rotary include service to others and the advancement of international understanding, goodwill, and peace through a world fellowship united in the ideal of service.

Mr. Seslar began his career with Benton-Carroll-Salem School District in September 2014. He is a graduate of Edgerton High School and ITT Technical Institute in Fort Wayne. Mr. Seslar is also a volunteer with Mid-County EMS.

Parmigian Committed to Writing Next Chapter at B-C-S

OAK HARBOR--On Saturday, February 29th B-C-S Board President Heather Dewitz announced: "It is with great enthusiasm and confidence that the Benton-Carroll-Salem Board of Education will retain Dr. Guy Parmigian as our Superintendent. The Board is committed to maintaining the strong leadership that he has brought to our district." Dewitz added: "The Board, along with Dr. Guy Parmigian, are excited to work with the administration and staff to write the next great chapter of this school district."

Dr. Parmigian stated that after a great deal of soul searching, he realized that his heart and passion was at Benton-Carroll-Salem Schools, and he decided to ask the Board if he could continue his work of serving the district. "I am grateful to this Board for the opportunity to remain at B-C-S," Parmigian said. "There is much work ahead as we strive to build the capacity of this school district to serve the current and future generations of Rockets. I am re-energized for this effort!"
